page.title: 08The Occult in The Shelsleys
page.content: Many supernatural events take place in the Teme Valley. In the principal house in the area,{The Court House}, an older occupant, Lady Lightfoot, was imprisoned by her husband and subse- quently murdered by him. Her ghost has been seen to drive a coach and four around the landing, down into the hall and into the lake behind the house. {Witchery Hole}, situated above the river on the hillside, is said to be the place where witches were burned in mediaeval times and there is a spot where nothing can be grown. In what is now called{Westmill {Cottage}, a ghostly presence is often felt, usually by strangers. It is said to be a friendly woman and there is one door in the house that cannot be closed despite locks and bolts. This cottage is situated directly below Witchery Hole.
